abstract.para: This article demonstrates how to implement host-level &nvidia; GPU support via the open-driver. The open-driver is part of the core package repositories. Therefore, there is no need to compile it or download executable packages. This driver is built into the operating system rather than dynamically loaded by the &nvidia; GPU Operator. This configuration is desirable for customers who want to pre-build all artifacts required for deployment into the image, and where the dynamic selection of the driver version via &kube; is not a requirement.
